intro: Gymnosporia falconeri var. kanjilalii, commonly known as the Kanjilalii Gymnosporia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of Nepal. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, cone-like structures containing its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
